supporting_spans: M. Noirtier, stretching himself out at his ease in the chair. “Really, pray tell me all about it, for it must be interesting.”
“Ah, you have heard of the landing of the emperor?” continued Noirtier, “Well, then, in return for your story,” continued Noirtier, “I will tell you another.”
contradicting_spans: M. Noirtier was vice-president of the club in the Rue Saint-Jacques
M. Noirtier was found dead in his house
reasoning: Contradiction (temporal): The evidence contradicts the claim that M. Noirtier joined the Girondins and broke with Robespierre over whether courts should keep formal procedures.

analysis.claim_text: Under the alias “Citizen Noirtier” he joined the Girondins, drafted parts of the Revolutionary Code and broke with Robespierre over whether courts should keep formal procedures.

sub_claims.text: Under the alias ‘Citizen Noirtier’ he joined the Girondins.
He drafted parts of the Revolutionary Code.
He broke with Robespierre over whether courts should keep formal procedures.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (temporal): The evidence contradicts the claim that M. Noirtier joined the Girondins and broke with Robespierre over whether courts should keep formal procedures.
